answerText: Navier-Stokes equations[10] The Navier-Stokes equations are formed from the combination of the fluid kinematics equation and this type of equation, which for a Newtonian fluid calculates fluid stress using the unity tensor and strain rate. They generally map the response of a particular material to an external stress.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Maryland A and Ohio State A | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These equations take into account convection currents and contain diffusion numbers. For 10 points each: [10] Name this set of doubly-eponymous, difficult-to-solve equations that describe fluid mechanics.
